channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT

item.title: Report X-2023081556
item.description:
Report X-2023081556

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While Loading trucks to go out for deliveries, a package handler found that the bottom of the hazmat box was wet. It was places in a red hazmat tote and brought to the QA cage to be processed as damaged. DescribePack: There was a crack in the plastic 1 Gallon bottle towards the bottom that was about 1/2 inch wide. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in red hazmat tote and brought to the QA cage to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023081726
item.description:
Report X-2023081726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO CALL WEARING PROPER PPE, ON ARRIVAL SAW THE BOX SITTING ON THE SLIDE. THEN FOLLOWING UPS DMP PROCEDURES, PLACED THE CONTENTS IN A SPILL TRAY. THEN TRANSPORTED THEM BACK TO THE CLERK PROCESSING STATION WHERE THEY ARE BEING DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING DMP PROTOCOLS.

THEN FOLLOWING UPS DMP PROCEDURES, PLACED THE CONTENTS IN A SPILL TRAY. THEN TRANSPORTED THEM BACK TO THE CLERK PROCESSING STATION WHERE THEY ARE BEING DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING DMP PROTOCOLS.

Report X-2023081405

  • City: SALT LAKE CITY

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKER, NOTICED IT WAS A HAZARDOUS METERIAL AND USING PPE AND DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CONTAINED AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO PROSSESING CENTER AT PROSSESING CENTER THE PRODUCT WOULD NOT STOP LEAKING SO RESPONDER ABSORBED THE MATERIAL AND PROCESSED THOUGH DMP

item.title: Report X-2023081347
item.description:
Report X-2023081347

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE FOUND IN THE UNLOAD WITH WET SPOT. UPON OPENING RESPONDER FOUND THAT ONE OF THE LIDS HAD COMPLETELY COME OFF. BOTH CONTINERS CONTAMINATED AND ALL MATERIAL PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report I-2023080027
item.description:
Report I-2023080027

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: OREM
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE DMP TABLE. RESPONDER MARKED PACKAGE AS A LEAKING PACKAGE IN ETT WERE ETT STATED TO PROCESS MATERIAL THROUGH DMP. RESPONDER HAD FOUND THE SDS TO COEFECT MINUTE SPRAY. SDS STATED WAS A UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTINS. RESPONDER THEN SOLIDIFIED THE REMAINING CONTAINERS AND BAGGED AS DMP MATERIAL, FINISHED PROCESSING THROUGH DMP AND SET THE PACKAGE ASIDE. RESPONDER CALLED HAZMAT HELP LINE.
